chapter.title: Image format options
chapter.subtitle: Plugin images
chapter.para: The plugin images is the core plugin that deals with the formatting options for the main map. It handles the size of the image and its filetype.

sect1.title: images.ini (client-side)
sect1.para: Here are the options that can be set :

listitem.para: mapSizesActivemapSizesActive: boolean; if true, displays a drop-down list of available mapsizes ; if false a fixed size is used (defined by the two following parameters).
mapWidthmapWidth: mainmap width in pixels if mapSizesActive = false
mapHeightmapHeight: mainmap height in pixels if mapSizesActive = false
mapSizes.#.width mapSizes.#.width: (#=0,1,2...) available mainmap width in pixels for mapsize # (when mapSizesActive = true)
mapSizes.#.height mapSizes.#.height: (#=0,1,2...) available mainmap height in pixels for mapsize # (when mapSizesActive = true)
mapSizes.#.label mapSizes.#.label: (#=0,1,2...) label that describes mapsize #; appears in drop-down list. If not specified, a <width>x<height> pattern is used as the label.
mapSizesDefault mapSizesDefault: integer indicates the default mapsize to be used (among the above #). Only when mapSizesActive = true.

sect1.para: If no mapsize settings are found, the default mapsize is 400x200 pixels.

sect1.title: images.ini (server-side)
sect1.para: Here are the options that can be set :

listitem.para: maxMapWidthmaxMapWidth: maximum allowed width in pixels of the generated mainmap. If the value requested by the client is greater, maxMapWidth takes precedence over it.
maxMapHeightmaxMapHeight: maximum allowed height in pixels of the generated mainmap. If the value requested by the client is greater, maxMapHeight takes precedence over it.

sect2.title: General image type
sect2.para: The general output fileformat is handled by Mapserver. The basic command in the mapfile is IMAGETYPE png|jpeg|gif...imagetype Then the OUTPUTFORMAT objects may set properties for each possible fileformat. Example (for jpeg) outputformat:

para.screen: OUTPUTFORMAT NAME jpeg DRIVER "GD/JPEG" MIMETYPE "image/jpeg" IMAGEMODE RGB FORMATOPTION QUALITY=85 EXTENSION "jpg" END

sect2.para: See the available options for each format in the Mapserver doc.

Important note if you intend to use pdf printing : interlaced png images are not supported by the fpdf library that is used in this module. Consequently, you must have the option FORMATOPTION "INTERLACE=OFF" in the definition of the png OUTPUTFORMAT. Here is the complete object :

para.screen: OUTPUTFORMAT NAME png DRIVER "GD/PNG" MIMETYPE "image/png" IMAGEMODE PC256 EXTENSION "png" FORMATOPTION "INTERLACE=OFF" END

sect2.title: Automatic imagetype switch
sect2.para: It is often desirable to adapt the imagetype of the map to the represented data. Typically, vector data is well rendered in png, while the colors of a raster background require either jpeg or png24 format. CartoWeb includes a mechanism that automatically switches the format when specific layers are selected. A special metadata of the layers triggers this behavior force_imagetype:
This metadata overrides the general fileformat of the mainmap (but not of the legend icons; these stay in the initial fileformat).
